dared again to blast me by his presence, I might, with unfailing aim, put an end to the existence of the monstrous Image which I had endued with the mockery of a soul still more monstrous. My father still desired to delay our departure, fearful that I could not sustain the fatigues of a journey: for I was a shattered wreck,—the shadow of
My strength was gone. I was a mere skeleton; and fever night and day preyed upon my wasted frame.<p/> <p/>Still, as I urged our leaving Ireland with such inquietude and impatience
thought it best to yield. We took our passage on board a vessel bound for Havre-de-Grace, and sailed
me; the dashing waves were around: the cloudy sky above; the fiend was not here: a sense of security

restlessness <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0131__main__d3e24826"/>he<del eID="c57-0131__main__d3e24826"/> awok me and pointed <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0132__main__d3e24843"/>and pointed<del eID="c57-0132__main__d3e24843"/> to
irresistible, disastrous future, imparted to me a kind
the human mind is by its structure peculiarly susceptible
